intro: Xanthosia pannosa, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. Xanthosia pannosa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
